color_preview.markdownDescription: Whether or not to show color previews

image_preview.markdownDescription: Whether or not to show image previews

image_scope_selector.default: meta.tag meta.attribute-with-value string | markup.underline.link.image.markdown | meta.property-value.css meta.function-call string
image_scope_selector.markdownDescription:
Scope selector to define applicable regions where image previews should be enabled. The regions should span no more than the actual image link URL or data URI (possible string quotes at the begin and end are allowed).

For an explanation how scope selectors work see https://www.sublimetext.com/docs/selectors.html.

extensionless_image_preview.markdownDescription:
Whether or not to try and show image previews for URLs missing extensions
(e.g., `https://avatars.githubusercontent.com/u/684879?s=200&v=4`)

This setting applies only to mouse hover and is ignored when image previews are manually invoked from the command palette or a key binding.

^.*$.markdownDescription: Substitution to be used when resolving image URLs

avif_converter.markdownDescription:
Image converter program for the AVIF file format.

Supported options are:
- "magick" (ImageMagick)

svg_converter.markdownDescription:
Image converter program for the SVG file format.

Supported options are:
- "inkscape" (Inkscape)
- "magick" (ImageMagick)

webp_converter.markdownDescription:
Image converter program for the WebP file format.

Supported options are:
- "dwebp" (precompiled WebP decoder from https://developers.google.com/speed/webp/docs/precompiled)
- "magick" (ImageMagick)

popup_border_width.markdownDescription: The border width of the popups. This does not necessarily correspond with actual pixel values, depending on your screen resolution and font size.

markdownEnumDescriptions: Draw the border with rounded corners.
Draw a small pointer triangle above the top border.
Add a button for image previews to open image in new tab.

popup_style.markdownDescription:
Popup style configuration. Allows to tweak the appearance, e.g. if popup shadows are enabled.

Supported options are:
- "rounded" (draw the border with rounded corners)
- "pointer" (draw a small pointer triangle above the top border)
- "open_image_button" (add a button for image previews to open image in new tab)
